DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Local Follow-up Technique Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: User-defined numeric codes used to flag cases that need unusual follow-up methods.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Local Follow-up Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: User-defined codes used to flag cases that need unusual follow-up methods.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:To occur again.:The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Affecting only a restricted part or area._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: See NAACCR Data Dictionary, Eleventh Edition, for coding instructions.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Local-Regional; affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
